Key Match Events: Brandon Miller scored off an offensive rebound at the buzzer to lift Charlotte Hornets to a thrilling 108-107 victory over the Detroit Pistons.
Miles Bridges had 27 points and LaMelo Ball added 25 points on five 3-pointers for the Hornets.
Cade Cunningham had a triple-double for Detroit with 20 points, 10 rebounds and 10 assists.
Jaden Ivey added 21 points for the Pistons.
Ronald Holland picked up the loose ball and drove from halfcourt for a go-ahead layup with 6.3 seconds left to give the Pistons the lead.
On Charlotte’s final possession, Miller grabbed Grant Williams' missed 3-pointer and quickly put it back in off the backboard for the winner.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detroit had a big size advantage coming into the game with Charlotte centers Mark Williams and Nick Richards out with injuries, but that was quickly negated after Jalen Duren left the game in the first quarter with an ankle injury and did not return.
On Friday night the Pistons host the Hawks, while the Hornets host the Pacers.
